DataElement.preferredName: Non-Index Lesion irRC Non-Measurable Response Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease response in individual tumor lesions other than the largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy using the Immune-Related Response Criteria (irRC).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Non-Index Lesion Non-Measurable Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._Any tumor lesion other than the largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy._Not possible to be measured._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any tumor lesion other than the largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy.:Not possible to be measured.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Any tumor lesion other than the largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of response criteria designed to capture additional response patterns observed with immune therapy beyond those described by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) or WHO criteria._Not possible to be measured._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An overall level of substantial worsening in non-target disease that is of a magnitude that, even in the presence of SD or PR in target disease, the treating physician would feel it important to change therapy. (RECIST)

Concepts.definition: An overall level of substantial worsening in non-target disease that is of a magnitude that, even in the presence of SD or PR in target disease, the treating physician would feel it important to change therapy. (RECIST)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stable; subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune-Related Response Criteria Non-Measurable Response Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A set of response criteria designed to capture additional response patterns observed with immune therapy beyond those described by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) or WHO criteria.:Not possible to be measured.:Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A set of response criteria designed to capture additional response patterns observed with immune therapy beyond those described by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) or WHO criteria.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
